content: itty bitty mushroom pattern about this pattern i am releasing it for free because the techniques used are heavily influenced by craftyintentions and subsequently lawren lewis s free mushroom pattern the real joy of it for me is how flexible you can be with this no two mushrooms have to be the same any yarn and matching hook size will work if you want it longer or shorter it s easy to add or subtract row as long as the numbers on the stem and the cap match in the end materials needed ● yarn in stem color ● yarn in cap color ● corresponding hook ideas for stuffing the cap catnip wooden or plastic beads crinkly material like a plastic bag bells etc you can also find keychain kits for super cheap to make these into keychains glossary magic_ring- magic_ring double_crochet- double_crochet slip_stitch- slip_stitch blo- back loop only chain- chain flo- front loop only single_crochet- single &- indicates two stitches being worked crochet into the same stitch half_double_crochet- half double - repeat the steps in the parentheses as crochet many times as indicated fpdc- front post double_crochet stem *note this piece is worked with the slip_stitch ch1 join row instructions st ct 1 single_crochet 6 in magic_ring slip_stitch ch1 6 2 incx6 slip_stitch ch1 12 3 in blo single_crochet 2 increase x4 slip_stitch ch1 16 4 decrease single_crochet 2 x4 slip_stitch chain 1 12 5 single_crochet 4 decrease x2 slip_stitch ch1 10 *note at this row or the next i like to insert a marble to help offset the weight of the cap 6 decrease single_crochet 3 x 2 slip_stitch ch1 8 7 single_crochet 2 decrease x 2 slip_stitch ch1 6 8 single_crochet 6 slip_stitch ch1 6 9 single_crochet 6 slip_stitch ch1 6 10 in flo increase x6 slip_stitch ch2 12 11 double_crochet&fpdc x12 slip_stitch and fasten_off with short 24 yarn tail to be tucked inside cap style 1 pointy spiral *note this piece is worked in the spiral do not slip_stitch ch1 row instructions st ct 1 single_crochet 4 in magic_ring 4 2 single_crochet 4 4 3 increase single_crochet 3 5 4 increase single_crochet 4 6 5 increase single_crochet 5 7 6 increase single_crochet 6 8 7 increase increase single_crochet 6 10 8 increase increase single_crochet 8 12 9 increase increase single_crochet 10 14 10 increase increase single_crochet 12 16 11 increase increase single_crochet 14 18 12 increase increase single_crochet 16 20 13 increase increase single_crochet 18 22 14 increase increase single_crochet 20 24 15 in this round you will attach the cap to 24 the body with a half_double_crochet to create a stitch in this row you will yarn over then insert your hook into the next stitch on the cap then holding the mushroom stem to the cap you will go through just the closest loop technically the back loop of the last row of the stem optional about ⅔ of the way around you may want to insert catnip bells or other goodies half_double_crochet 24
